headerText: The `v-btn` component can be used as a Floating action button. This provides an application a main point of action. Combined with the `v-speed-dial` component, you can create a diverse set of functions available for your users.

usage.desc: Floating action buttons can be attached to material to signify a promoted action in your application. The default size will be used in most cases, whereas the `small` variant can be used to maintain continuity with similar sized elements.

small.desc: For better visual appeal, we use a small button to match our list avatars.

displayAnimation.desc: When displaying for the first time, a floating action button should animate onto the screen. Here we use the `v-fab-transition` with v-show. You can also use any custom transition provided by Vuetify or your own.

lateralScreens.desc: When changing the default action of your button, it is recommended that you display a transition to signify a change. We do this by binding the `key` prop to a piece of data that can properly signal a change in action to the Vue transition system. While you can use a custom transition for this, ensure that you set the `mode` prop to **out-in**.

speedDial.desc: The speed-dial component has an very robust api for customizing your FAB experience exactly how you want.

v-btn.block: Expands the button to 100% of available space
v-btn.icon: Designates the button as icon - round and flat
v-btn.round: Button will be round on the sides

v-speed-dial.direction: Direction in which speed-dial content will show. Possible values are `top`, `bottom`, `left`, `right`.
